text:
It would be very useful to add a facility to XML Schema Assertion to use part 
of the response or a variable. This comes very handy for validating Web 
Services Response Messages which are wrapped in SOAP. This utility would enable 
validation of embedded XML messages against its schemas, thus eliminating the 
need to modify original schemas to add SOAP definitions.
creator: amelaao@gmail.com

text:
Created attachment 19217
Patch for the XMLSchema assertion and GUI files using rel-2-2 as the base.

I have substantially modified the XML Schema assertion with the patch above. 
It will now accept multiple XSD files and validate an XML response based on all
of the XSD types.

The GUI class is /very/ rudimentary as I know next to nothing about Swing.  I
used the AssertionGui class as a basis for the new XML Schema interface.  The
text rows need to be cleaned up to not allow multiple lines in each row.  A
better interface would be nice as well.

The XMLSchemaAssertion class probably needs to be tightened up somewhat as
there is little to no parameter checking.  In addition, the
internationalization properties file stuff needs to be checked by someone that
knows more about it than I.
creator: pkuyken@gmail.com

text:
Created attachment 19218
Updated patch for XML Schema assertion using rel-2-2 as base

I've updated the patch file.  It seems that my IDE took it upon itself to
change all of the indents and whatnot.	The patch is still rather significant.


XMLSchemaAssertion Change notes:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The main structural change is to move the meat of the setSchemaResult() method
into getResult() method however the actual logic that resided in
setSchemaResult() changed very little.

In the patched version of XMLSchemaAssertion at line 145 is the only change
done to the actual parsing portion of the code.  Instead of passing in a single
String containing a filename, a String array is passed with each element being 
an XSD filename that should be included in the validation.  

Lines 124-138 were added to read pull the XSD filenames from the test plan
structure.

There were several unused attributes methods that were removed and attributes
and corresponding accessor methods were added to support the additional
functionality.

I cleaned up the import list to reflect the new import requirements.

I removed several (now) unused String constants.
===========================================================================

XMLSchemaAssertionGUI change notes:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

So much of XMLSchemaAssertionGUI has changed that it is practically a rewrite. 
I based the GUI class on the AssertionGui class.  There are some issues with
the list, mainly being able to have multiple lines in the entry.  Like I said
before, Swing isn't my forte so I'll defer those changes to someone more
knowledgeable.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Unfortunately I cannot apply the patch as it stands.

This is because it would invalidate any existing test plans, as the property 
that stores the file name has been renamed, and is now a list, not a string.

The test element needs to be able to work with existing test plans.
